17: # The following two options make you a better netizen, since they
18: # tell dnsmasq to filter out queries which the public DNS cannot
19: # answer, and which load the servers (especially the root servers)
20: # unnecessarily. If you have a dial-on-demand link they also stop
21: # these requests from bringing up the link unnecessarily.

30: # which can trigger dial-on-demand links needlessly.

15: # Give a host with Ethernet address 11:22:33:44:55:66 or
16: # 12:34:56:78:90:12 the IP address 192.168.0.60. Dnsmasq will assume
17: # that these two Ethernet interfaces will never be in use at the same
18: # time, and give the IP address to the second, even if it is already
19: # in use by the first. Useful for laptops with wired and wireless
23: # Give the machine which says its name is "bert" IP address
27: # Always give the host with client identifier 01:02:02:04

35: # Enable the address given for "judge" in /etc/hosts
36: # to be given to a machine presenting the name "judge" when
37: # it asks for a DHCP lease.
40: # Never offer DHCP service to a machine whose Ethernet
44: # Ignore any client-id presented by the machine with Ethernet
45: # address 11:22:33:44:55:66. This is useful to prevent a machine
46: # being treated differently when running under different OS's or
47: # between PXE boot and OS boot.

24: # Set the root directory for files available via FTP.

36: # Set the boot file name only when the "red" tag is set.
39: # An example of dhcp-boot with an external TFTP server: the name and IP
40: # address of the server are given after the filename.
41: # Can fail with old PXE ROMS. Overridden by --pxe-service.
44: # If there are multiple external tftp servers having a same name
45: # (using /etc/hosts) then that name can be specified as the
46: # tftp_servername (the third option to dhcp-boot) and in that
47: # case dnsmasq resolves this name and returns the resultant IP
48: # addresses in round robin fasion. This facility can be used to
49: # load balance the tftp load among a set of servers.
